contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox company| company_name = Quad/Graphics, Inc.| company_logo = [[File:Quad Graphics logo.jpg]]| company_type = [[Public company|Public]] ({{NYSE|QUAD}})| company_slogan = Innovative people ''redefining'' print| foundation = 1971| founder = Harry V. Quadracci| location = [[Sussex, Wisconsin]], [[United States]]| key_people = Joel Quadracci, President and CEO| industry = Commercial and industrial printing| num_employees = 25,000 <ref name=VertisIntegration /> (2013)| market cap = | products = | revenue = $4 billion [[USD]] <ref name=VertisIntegration /> (2012)| homepage = [http://www.qg.com qg.com] }} [[File:QuadGraphicsPlantUS41.jpg|thumb|left|Quad plant near [[Lomira, Wisconsin]], along [[U.S. Route 41]]]] '''Quad/Graphics''' is an [[United States|American]] [[printing]] company, based in [[Sussex, Wisconsin]]. It was founded on July 13, 1971, by Harry V. Quadracci, son of Harry R. Quadracci, whom the company [[website]] calls, "the Father of Web [[Offset printing|Offset Printing]]". The company has 39<ref name="PrintFacilities">{{cite web|title=Quad/Graphics North American print production facilities|url=http://www.qg.com/aboutus/platform/na_print_production.asp|publisher=Quad Graphics|accessdate=13 July 2011}}</ref> printing facilities in the United States, as well as facilities throughout [[Europe]], [[Canada]], and [[Latin America]]. Quad prints numerous magazines, including ''BusinessWeek'', ''[[Milwaukee Magazine]]'', [[Time (magazine)|''Time'']], ''[[Sports Illustrated]]'' and [[People (magazine)|''People'']]. In July 2010, Quad/Graphics acquired competitor [[World Color Press]].<ref name="WCannouncement">{{Cite web|url=http://www.qg.com/news/quad_news_detail.asp?NewMessageID=31402|title=Quad/Graphics To Acquire WorldColor Press Release|accessdate=2010-11-01}}</ref> In August 2010, the company announced that it would be closing five of its plants as part of a consolidation plan related to the acquisition of World Color Press.<ref name="PlantConsolidation">{{Cite web|url=http://www.qg.com/news/quad_news_detail.asp?NewMessageID=35074|title=Quad/Graphics Begins Plant Consolidation Phase of Integration Plan|accessdate=2010-08-06}}</ref> In November 2010, Quad/Graphics, Inc acquired Commercial and Specialty Products Printer HGI Company.<ref>{{cite web|title=Quad/Graphics Acquires Commercial and Specialty Products Printer HGI Company|url=http://www.marketwatch.com/story/quadgraphics-acquires-commercial-and-specialty-products-printer-hgi-company-2010-11-04|publisher=Market Watch|accessdate=8 November 2010}}</ref> In July 2011, Quad announced an asset swap with the Transcontinental Inc where Quad would acquire Transcontinental's Mexican assets along with its black and white book [[Printer (publishing)|printing business]] for U.S. export in exchange for seven of Quad Graphics' Canadian facilities.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.qg.com/news/quad_news_detail.asp?NewMessageID=38718|title=Quad/Graphics to Acquire Mexican Printing Assets From and Sell Canadian Assets to Transcontinental Press Release|accessdate=2011-07-13}}</ref> On January 16, 2013 Quad/Graphics announced that it completed its acquisition of Vertis Holdings, Inc.<ref name="VertisIntegration">{{cite web|url=http://www.qg.com/news/quad_news_detail.asp?NewMessageID=38776|title=Quad Completes Acquisition of Vertis|accessdate=2013-01-18}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.qg.com/ QG.com - Quad/Graphics homepage] {{Milwaukee Based Companies}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Quad Graphics}} [[Category:Companies listed on the New York Stock Exchange]] [[Category:Companies based in Milwaukee, Wisconsin]] [[Category:Waukesha County, Wisconsin]] {{US-company-stub}} {{Wisconsin-stub}}
